item.title: Snowflake Gives Strong Outlook With Focus on New AI Tools
item.description: Snowflake Inc. gave a strong outlook for quarterly sales after launching a slew of new products over the last year.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Sridhar Ramaswamy, chief executive officer of Snowflake Computing Inc., at the Semafor World Economy Summit during the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and World Bank Spring meetings in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, April 25, 2025. The International Monetary Fund sharply lowered its forecasts for world growth for this year and next, warning the outlook could deteriorate further as US President Donald Trump's tariffs spark a global trade war.

item.title: Google’s Sergey Brin Gives Shares Worth $700 Million as a Gift
item.description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin, tapping a personal fortune that exceeds $140 billion, gave nearly $700 million in Alphabet Inc. shares away as a gift.
item.dc:creator: Biz Carson, Julia Love

media:content.media:description: Former president of Google Sergey Brin attends the Vanity Fair Oscars Party at the Wallis Annenberg Center for the Performing Arts in Beverly Hills, California, on March 10, 2024. (Photo by Michael TRAN / AFP) (Photo by MICHAEL TRAN/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Zoom Reports Solid Revenue on Growth in Enterprise Customers
item.description: Zoom Communications Inc. reported revenue from enterprise customers that topped analysts’ estimates, suggesting stronger sales among its expanded suite of products.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: The Zoom website on a laptop arranged in Germantown, New York, US, on Saturday, May 13, 2023. Zoom Video Communications Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on May 23. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: MercadoLibre CEO Steps Aside After 25 Years for Chairman Job
item.description: MercadoLibre Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marcos Galperin will become executive chairman of the e-commerce and financial technology giant, marking the first change in the top job since he founded Latin America’s most valuable company more than two decades ago.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Gillespie, Maria Clara Cobo

media:content.media:description: Marcos Galperin

item.title: Nvidia CEO Slams US Chip Rules, Trump’s AI Action Plan | Bloomberg Technology
item.description: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow speaks with White House AI advisor Sriram Krishnan about the US AI Action Plan and President Donald Trump’s approach to tech diplomacy. Plus, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says the US should ease restrictions on exporting chips to China. And Google shares rise as investors digest the company’s AI announcements. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: AT&T Buys Lumen’s Consumer Fiber Business for $5.75 Billion
item.description: AT&T Inc. agreed to buy the consumer fiber operations of Lumen Technologies Inc. for $5.75 billion, expanding its fast broadband service in major cities like Denver and Las Vegas.
item.dc:creator: Michelle F Davis

media:content.media:description: An AT&T store in New York, US, on Monday, Oct. 21, 2024. AT&T Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on October 23.

item.title: CoreWeave Surges Past Analyst Targets as Citi Doubles Theirs
item.description: CoreWeave Inc.’s rally is running so hot it’s leaving analysts’ stock predictions in the dust. Citi Research more than doubled their 12-month price target on the stock to a Wall Street high Wednesday morning. When the market opened shares blew past it in the first 15 minutes of trading.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke

item.title: Kalshi Pulls Announcement on xAI Deal Hours After Touting It
item.description: Kalshi Inc. withdrew announcements about a collaboration with Elon Musk’s artificial-intelligence firm xAI just hours after a top executive at the prediction markets firm touted the deal.
item.dc:creator: Paige Smith

media:content.media:description: The Kalshi logo arranged on a smartphone in New York, US, on Monday, Feb. 10, 2025. The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is asking Crypto.com and Kalshi Inc. to explain how their recently launched Super Bowl event contracts comply with derivatives regulations. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Nvidia CEO Urges US to Ease AI Curbs After China ‘Failure’
item.description: Nvidia Corp. chief Jensen Huang blasted the “failure” of US restrictions intended to contain China’s technological ascent, calling on the White House to lower barriers to AI chip sales before American firms cede that market to up-and-coming rivals such as Huawei Technologies Co.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lanhee Lee, Vlad Savov

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg

item.title: Microsoft Touts Sales in Competition With Snowflake, Databricks
item.description: Microsoft Corp. said its data-focused product, Fabric, is rapidly picking up customers in competition with rivals including Snowflake Inc. and Databricks Inc.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: A Microsoft store in New York.

item.title: OpenAI to Buy AI Device Startup From Apple Veteran Jony Ive in $6.5 Billion Deal
item.description: OpenAI will acquire the AI device startup co-founded by Apple Inc. veteran Jony Ive in a nearly $6.5 billion all-stock deal, joining forces with the legendary designer to make a push into hardware.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman, Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Jony Ive, left, is collaborating with OpenAI’s Sam Altman as part of a nearly $6.5 billion deal.

item.title: Amazon CEO Says Customer Demand, Prices Steady Despite Tariffs
item.description: Amazon.com Inc. Chief Executive Officer Andy Jassy said the online retailer hasn’t seen any meaningful reduction in consumer spending or an increase in prices as a result of tariffs introduced by US President Donald Trump earlier this year.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Soper

media:content.media:description: Andy Jassy, chief executive officer of Amazon.com Inc., speaks during an unveiling event in New York, US, on Wednesday, Feb. 26, 2025. Jassy said Amazon is in the process of building over 100 generative artificial intelligence (AI) features.

item.title: US to Keep China Chip Curbs, Spurning Nvidia’s Call for Relief
item.description: The Trump administration will maintain efforts to keep advanced artificial intelligence technology out of China’s hands, a top White House official said, brushing off calls from Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang to ease restrictions on chip exports to the world’s second largest economy.
item.dc:creator: Michael Shepard, Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: Nvidia Corp. chips in Taipei, Taiwan.

item.title: Microsoft Seizes Domains Linked to Ransomware in Cyber Dragnet
item.dc:creator: Jeff Stone

media:content.media:description: Heat map detailing global spread of Lumma malware infections and encounters across Windows devices.

item.title: BlackRock Adds to AI-Stocks Bet in $160 Billion Model Portfolios
item.description: The world’s largest asset manager is adding to bets on the artificial intelligence within its US model portfolios while trimming its overall equity risk because of tariff uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Emily Graffeo

item.title: Alphabet Gains After Adding More AI Functions to Search
item.description: Alphabet Inc. shares gained after the company said it will offer “AI mode” in search to all US users, showing its commitment to redesigning its core business to keep pace with new rivals in the artificial intelligence age.
item.dc:creator: Julia Love, Davey Alba

media:content.media:description: Sundar Pichai, chief executive officer of Alphabet Inc., during an interview for an episode of "The David Rubenstein Show: Peer-to-Peer Conversations" in New York, US, on Friday, Sept. 20, 2024. Pichai said it will take many years to resolve Google's antitrust battles, downplaying the idea that they pose an immediate threat to the company's business.

item.title: Chatbot Arena Group Goes From Academic Project to $600 Million Startup
item.description: An effort that began at UC Berkeley as a way to rank AI models has raised $100 million from investors including Andreessen Horowitz.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Metz, Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: Jaque Silva/NurPhoto via Getty Images

item.title: Lagos Startups Lure 42% More Funding, Defying Slowdown in Africa
item.description: Startups in Nigeria’s commercial hub of Lagos attracted 42% more investment last year, as the presence of businesses such as Flutterwave Inc. and Interswitch Ltd. showcased the city’s appeal as a hub for new enterprises.
item.dc:creator: Emele Onu, Anthony Osae-Brown

media:content.media:description: Lagos, Nigeria.

item.title: Palo Alto Tumbles to Lowest in a Year Following Earnings Report
item.description: Palo Alto Networks Inc. briefly tumbled to its lowest in more than a year on Wednesday, a day after the cybersecurity company gave an outlook that failed to fully ease growth concerns.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Martin

media:content.media:description: Palo Alto Networks headquarters in Santa Clara, California, US, on Monday, Aug. 14, 2023. Palo Alto Networks Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on August 18.

item.title: Tanzania Curbs Internet After X Posts Fake President’s Death
item.description: Tanzania restricted internet access after several government accounts on the X social network platform were compromised.
item.dc:creator: Fumbuka Ng'Wanakilala

media:content.media:description: Samia Suluhu Hassan, president of Tanzania.

item.title: Space Startup Iceye Boosts Poland Investment to Meet Army Demand
item.description: Iceye Oy, the Finnish maker of advanced Earth-observation satellites, plans further investments in Poland as it sees increased demand from countries that want to improve their intelligence-gathering capabilities in space.
item.dc:creator: Konrad Krasuski

media:content.media:description: A depiction of Iceye’s SAR satellites.

item.title: Italian Defense Firm Leonardo Closes in on Deal for US Tech Company
item.description: Leonardo SpA’s US unit is closing in on the purchase of an American technology firm, people familiar with the matter said, in a move that would bolster the defense contractor’s product capabilities in the world’s largest weapons market.
item.dc:creator: Daniele Lepido, Alberto Brambilla, Aaron Kirchfeld

media:content.media:description: An AWHero drone displayed on the Leonardo stand at the Farnborough International Airshow in 2024.

item.title: The $34.5 Billion-Dollar Deal That Started With a Love Letter
item.description: One of the biggest deals of the year so far started around Valentine’s Day, with a love letter.
item.dc:creator: Michelle F Davis, Liana Baker

media:content.media:description: The Cox Enterprises Inc. headquarters in Atlanta.

item.title: Baidu Posts Surprise Sales Jump in Worsening China AI Battle
item.description: Baidu Inc. posted a surprise rise in revenue after China’s internet search leader fended off intensifying competition in AI and a persistent economic downturn.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Zheping Huang

media:content.media:description: The Baidu Technology Park in Beijing.

item.title: Malaysia Downplays Huawei Deal as US Checks China’s AI Reach
item.description: Malaysia declared it’ll build a first-of-its-kind AI system powered by Huawei Technologies Co. chips, only to distance itself from that statement a day later, underscoring the Asian nation’s delicate position in the US-Chinese AI race.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Ram Anand

media:content.media:description: A Huawei Technologies Co. chip.

item.title: Motorola Solutions Nears $4.5 Billion Deal for Radio Maker Silvus
item.description: Motorola Solutions Inc. is in advanced talks to acquire closely held wireless-radio maker Silvus Technologies for around $4.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Liana Baker, Ryan Gould, David Carnevali

media:content.media:description: Motorola walkie-talkies.

item.title: Not Every Team Deserves a Netflix Sports Documentary
item.description: Customers love them, but streamers are getting choosier in what they say yes to.
item.dc:creator: Ira Boudway

item.title: OpenAI’s Stargate Project Raises Hope, Questions in West Texas Town
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Emily Chang travels to the plains of West Texas to report on the Stargate AI “megafactory” taking shape there.
item.dc:creator: Emily Chang

media:content.media:description: Emily Chang speaks with developer Chase Lochmiller, chief executive officer of Crusoe, at the OpenAI Stargate project construction site in Abilene, Texas.

item.title: Marks & Spencer Expects Cyberattack to Cost £300 Million
item.description: Marks & Spencer Group Plc is facing a £300 million ($403 million) hit to operating profit this fiscal year from a cyberattack last month it blamed on human error that is still disrupting sales and operations.
item.dc:creator: Katie Linsell

item.title: SoftBank Taps Mizuho, SMBC, JPMorgan to Run $15 Billion Loan
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp.’s investments in AI will be financed through a loan in which Mizuho Bank Ltd., Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. serve as lead underwriters — a sign of the Japanese tech investor’s ability to secure financing for its outsized ambitions.
item.dc:creator: Taro Fuse, Min Jeong Lee

media:content.media:description: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son in front of a screen displaying a photo of him and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman.
